section.para: Processes a list of keys and values and returns a comma-separated list of the keys sorted based on their floating-point values.; Sort a list: exten => 123,1,Set(foo=${SORT(four:4|half:.5|hundred:100|pi:3.14|e:2.71828|minusone:-1)}) ; foo is now "minusone,half,e,pi,four,hundred"

formalpara.title: Internal help for this application in Asterisk 1.4:

para.screen:
-= Info about function 'SORT' =-
[Syntax] SORT(key1:val1[...][,keyN:valN])
[Synopsis] Sorts a list of key/vals into a list of keys, based upon the vals
[Description] Takes a comma-separated list of keys and values, each separated by a colon, and returns a comma-separated list of the keys, sorted by their values. Values will be evaluated as floating-point numbers.
